2018-10-21T18:06:05Z: Pirelli has increased the mandatory rear tyre pressure minimums from 20 to 21.5psi for this race, which is a significant difference. The tyres will be more stable in the fast corners, which is why this has been done, but it will be a negative for traction. As the tyre heats up because of wheelspin, the pressures will further increasing making it worse again. I can see this race being down to who has a car with the best traction and, hopefully, a driver who is more able to nurse the tyres – especially out of the slow corners. In the old days, 16-18psi was your rear tyre pressure window – lower for slower circuits and higher for ones with more high-speed corners.
